message_1: Using predicate logic, express the statement "all cows are mammals" as a logical expression.
message_2:
∀x (C(x) → M(x))

Here, ∀x represents "for all x", C(x) represents "x is a cow", and M(x) represents "x is a mammal". The arrow (→) represents implication, so the expression reads "for all x, if x is a cow, then x is a mammal".
